Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student can draw two students attempting to communicate, illustrating a problem of needing to talk over a distance.
The student can depict a string telephone with cups at either end, generally conveying the concept of a communication device.
The student can show some form of connection between the cups (e.g., a line indicating a string, but details may be unclear or simplified).
CANNOT: The student may not clearly illustrate how the cups and string allow people to send and receive sound (e.g., lacks indication of sound waves or movement).
The student might include additional materials not required, or fail to use only cups and string in their drawing (e.g., adds elements like megaphones or telephones).
The student may not accurately show how the communication over the string telephone works, possibly missing essential details like the tautness of the string affecting sound transmission.

The student might have a vague representation of sound traveling through the string, possibly missing out on showing sound waves or the direction of sound travel (e.g., arrows going the wrong way or missing entirely).
